nodes.name: DepositFactoryAuthority

typeDescriptions.typeString: literal_string "Factory cannot be the zero address."

arguments.value: Factory cannot be the zero address.

argumentTypes.typeString: literal_string "Factory cannot be the zero address."

typeDescriptions.typeString: literal_string "Factory can only be initialized once."

arguments.value: Factory can only be initialized once.

argumentTypes.typeString: literal_string "Factory can only be initialized once."

nodes.documentation:
@notice Set the address of the System contract on contract
         initialization.
 @dev Since this function is not access-controlled, it should be called
      transactionally with contract instantiation. In cases where a
      regular contract directly inherits from DepositFactoryAuthority,
      that should happen in the constructor. In cases where the inheritor
      is binstead used via a clone factory, the same function that
      creates a new clone should also trigger initialization.
nodes.name: initialize

typeDescriptions.typeString: literal_string "Factory initialization must have been called."

arguments.value: Factory initialization must have been called.

argumentTypes.typeString: literal_string "Factory initialization must have been called."

nodes.documentation: @notice Function modifier ensures modified function is only called by set deposit factory.

devdoc.details: Secured by setting the depositFactory address and using the onlyFactory         modifier on functions requiring restriction.

initialize(address).details: Since this function is not access-controlled, it should be called      transactionally with contract instantiation. In cases where a      regular contract directly inherits from DepositFactoryAuthority,      that should happen in the constructor. In cases where the inheritor      is binstead used via a clone factory, the same function that      creates a new clone should also trigger initialization.

userdoc.notice: Contract to secure function calls to the Deposit Factory.
